meanings.definition: The study or science of mountains.
meanings.sent1: In orologies, we learn about the formation of mountains.
meanings.sent2: Scientists enjoy exploring orologies to understand mountain ranges better.
meanings.sent3: The book on orologies made the mountains seem like giant puzzles to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an orologies, filled with peaks of knowledge waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with posters illustrating different aspects of orologies.

meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll contained a detailed orologies about the tallest peaks.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to this orologies when discussing mountain history.
meanings.sent3: Reading the orologies felt like embarking on a mountain adventure through words.
meanings.sent4: His words were an orologies, painting vivid pictures of the mountain landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The library had a rare collection of orologies from various mountain explorers.

meanings.sent1: The painter's orologies captured the beauty of the mountains in every stroke.
meanings.sent2: Tourists rely on detailed orologies to plan their mountain hikes.
meanings.sent3: The children's book offered a whimsical orologies of the magical mountain kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was an orologies, painting a picture of the mountains with each word.
meanings.sent5: The documentary provided a breathtaking orologies of the world's highest peaks.
